sourceDesc.p: Researched and written by Christopher Morrison, February 2009

div.head: Summary
div.p: The United States recognized Croatia as an independent state on April 7, 1992, when the George H.W. Bush Administration announced the decision in a White House statement.

div.head: U.S. Recognition of Croatia, 1992.
div.p: The United States recognized Croatia as an independent state on April 7, 1992, when the George H.W. Bush Administration announced the decision in a White House statement. Croatia had been a constituent part of Yugoslavia.

div.head: Establishment of Diplomatic Relations, 1992.
div.p: Diplomatic relations were established on August 6, 1992, when President George H.W. Bush announced the decision during remarks to the press.

div.head: Establishment of the American Embassy in Croatia, 1992.
div.p: The American Embassy in Zagreb was opened on August 25, 1992, with Ronald Nietzke as Chargé d’Affaires ad interim.
